message.content:
We need to identify which transactions represent purchases of fixed assets. In our data the “type” field is used to indicate the kind of transaction. Only those transactions whose type is “Fixed Assets Purchase” should be “added” for the purpose of the cash‐flow “purchase of fixed assets” amount.

In our provided data the rows with type “Fixed Assets Purchase” (with an id starting with FixedAsset20231231001) are as follows (the “amount” column is used):

1. FixedAsset20231231001 | Fixed Assets Purchase | … | amount = 242704.16  
2. FixedAsset20231231001 | Fixed Assets Purchase | … | amount = 474959.83  
3. FixedAsset20231231001 | Fixed Assets Purchase | … | amount = 465186.81  
4. FixedAsset20231231001 | Fixed Assets Purchase | … | amount = 432676.9  
5. FixedAsset20231231001 | Fixed Assets Purchase | … | amount = 423492.61  
6. FixedAsset20231231001 | Fixed Assets Purchase | … | amount = 226268.11  

(There appear later to be repeated entries; here we assume that each listed “Fixed Assets Purchase” transaction is to be included only once.)

Now, adding these together:

• 242704.16 + 474959.83 = 717663.99  
• 717663.99 + 465186.81 = 1,182850.80  
• 1,182850.80 + 432676.90 = 1,615527.70  
• 1,615527.70 + 423492.61 = 2,039020.31  
• 2,039020.31 + 226268.11 = 2,265288.42

Thus, the final purchase of fixed assets is 2,265,288.42.

Below is the answer formatted as requested:

--------------------------------------------------

```json
{"solution": {"Purchase of Fixed Assets": "2265288.42"}}
```
